contentrichtext.text: {{coord|53.779|-2.686|display=title|region:GB_scale:5000}} The '''Queen's Lancashire Regiment Museum''', at [[Fulwood, Lancashire|Fulwood]] Barracks in [[Preston,_Lancashire|Preston]], [[Lancashire]], England, claims to be "the largest Regimental archive and the premier centre for military historical research in the North West of England".<ref>[http://www.qlrmuseum.co.uk/ The regimental museum of the Queen's Lancashire Regiment], accessed 7 September 2009</ref> It chronicles the men of Lancashire who fought for their country during the wars. It also acts as an archive of battles fought by the [[Queen's Lancashire Regiment]] and its antecedent regiments, the East Lancashire, South Lancashire, Loyal North Lancashire, and Lancashire (Prince of Wales's Volunteers) Regiments. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.qlrmuseum.co.uk/ Museum website] * [http://www.armymuseums.org.uk/amot-search/default.asp?Category=Amot&Service=Museum-Display&reference=0000000083 Army museums information] * [http://www.culture24.org.uk/nw000037 Entry] in [[24 Hour Museum]] * [http://www.visitpreston.com/site/what-to-do/museums/queens-lancashire-regiment-museum VisitPreston.com information] [[Category:Museums in Preston]] [[Category:Regimental museums in England]] [[Category:Military history of Lancashire]] {{UK-museum-stub}}
